results.title: 'Way to go'
results.brief_description: Overviews school camps and excursions. Explains who is responsible for these events, the planning and approvals required prior to the trip, teacher and student preparation and legal and safety requirements.

results.title: Victoria's first settlers
results.creator_credit: Lili Steiner and Victoria. Ministry of Education
results.brief_description: The state historian of Victoria Mr Bernard Barrett talks to Trevor Lunn about Victoria’s Aboriginal past, the first British visitors, sealers and whalers and the settlements at Portland and Melbourne.

results.title: Partners in curriculum
results.creator_credit: Diane O'Connor and Victoria. Schools Division. Curriculum Branch
results.brief_description: A program which encourages the participation of teachers, students, parents and school based groups and committees in the planning and development of school curriculum. Examples of how this is happening at Mt. Clear High School, Tallangatta High School and Williamstown High School are shown. Curriculum support services are also briefly mentioned.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Diane O’Connor and Victoria. Schools Division. Curriculum Branch

results.title: Schools working with curriculum frameworks
results.creator_credit: Jeff Spencer, David Ferris and Victoria. Schools Division. Curriculum Branch
results.brief_description: Trevor Lunn introduces a panel including Dr. Max Stephens, Anne Gooding, Mary Weaven, Enid Mayfield, Geoff Whyte, Denis Cunningham and Geoff Burt who explain how the key ideas and issues of Curriculum Frameworks are being addressed by Schools. This panel of teachers and regional consultants discuss several specific frameworks areas.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Jeff Spencer, David Ferris and Victoria. Schools Division. Curriculum Branch

results.title: Bob Graham
results.creator_credit: Jeff Spencer, Lily Steiner and Victoria. Ministry of Education
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Cover to cover”.
Looks at the work of Bob Graham, an Australian author-illustrator. This successful illustrator has a clean, simple style which belies the depth and imagery of his work.

results.title: Impression of Oakleigh Technical School. . a caring place
results.brief_description: An overview of Oakleigh Technical School as seen throught the eyes of Scott, one of the students. The school is show as having a vibrant school council with an innovative, stimulating program.

results.title: Science needs girls too
results.creator_credit: Jeff Spencer, Sabina Baltrukomis and Victoria. Schools Division. Curriculum Branch
results.brief_description: A program featuring Leonie Gianetto, Ursula Groves and Ann Osman from the McClintock Collective and students from Swinburne Community School and Swinburne Technical School who examine ways in which girls can be encouraged to take a more active part in the sciences.
